intro: Xerotium montanum, commonly known as the mountain snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of western North America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, typically in July and August. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Xerotium montanum is often found in meadows and open areas at elevations above 7,000 feet.
